Key.Original: Float number which determines starting angle of the particle
Key.English: Float number which determines starting angle of the particle

Key.Original: Object/object selection name to attach this particle to.\nNOTE: this changes 'position' to relative to the object instead of world position.\nIn case of selecting a selection off-set is set automagically.
Key.English: Object/object selection name to attach this particle to.\nNOTE: this changes 'position' to relative to the object instead of world position.\nIn case of selecting a selection off-set is set automagically.

Key.Original: The selection on which the emitter is attached to, if any.
Key.English: The selection on which the emitter is attached to, if any.

Key.Original: Name of/path to the script to run right before destroying the particle.\nPosition of the particle is passed as '_this' variable
Key.English: Name of/path to the script to run right before destroying the particle.\nPosition of the particle is passed as '_this' variable

Key.Original: Speed loss coef at collision with ground, 0-1 for collisions, -1 disable collision. Default value -1.\nShould be used soberly, it has significant impact on performance.
Key.English: Speed loss coef at collision with ground, 0-1 for collisions, -1 disable collision. Default value -1.\nShould be used soberly, it has significant impact on performance.

Key.Original: Number of animation frames to play.\nStarts with 1, not 0 as with index.
Key.English: Number of animation frames to play.\nStarts with 1, not 0 as with index.

Key.Original: Interval of emitting particles from particle source, in seconds.
Key.English: Interval of emitting particles from particle source, in seconds.

Key.Original: Anim Starting Row (starts at 0).
Key.English: Anim Starting Row (starts at 0).

Key.Original: Life time of the particle, in seconds.
Key.English: Life time of the particle, in seconds.

Key.Original: Loop the particle animation.\nUnChecked = no loop, checked = loop.
Key.English: Loop the particle animation.\nUnchecked = no loop, checked = loop.

Key.Original: Anim Divisor.\nBasically the line length of the given sprites texture.\nFor example 'Universal' length is 16.
Key.English: Anim Divisor.\nBasically the line length of the given sprites texture.\nFor example 'Universal' length is 16.

Key.Original: Velocity vector (x, y, z) of the particle direction and speed in m/s.
Key.English: Velocity vector (x, y, z) of the particle direction and speed in m/s.

Key.Original: Placing of particle on (water) surface on start of it's existence, works only if circleRadius > 0.\nUnchecked = not on surface, checked = on surface.
Key.English: Placing of particle on (water) surface on start of it's existence, works only if circleRadius > 0.\nUnchecked = not on surface, checked = on surface.

Key.Original: Name of/path to the script to run every period determined by the TimerPeriod property.\nPosition of the particle is passed in '_this' variable.
Key.English: Name of/path to the script to run every period determined by the TimerPeriod property.\nPosition of the particle is passed in '_this' variable.

Key.Original: 3D world coordinate (x, y, z), if attached to object position relative to that object.
Key.English: 3D world coordinate (x, y, z), if attached to object position relative to that object.

Key.Original: Each MoveVelocity vector component will be changed with random value at interval defined with RandomDirectionPeriod.\nChange value is determined between 0 and RandomDirectionIntensity.
Key.English: Each MoveVelocity vector component will be changed with random value at interval defined with RandomDirectionPeriod.\nChange value is determined between 0 and RandomDirectionIntensity.

Key.Original: Interval in which a random change of the velocity vector happens, in seconds.
Key.English: Interval in which a random change of the velocity vector happens, in seconds.

Key.Original: Float number which determines number of rotations particle does in one second.
Key.English: Float number which determines number of rotations particle does in one second.

Key.Original: Randomizer for the RotationVelocity in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.
Key.English: Randomizer for the RotationVelocity in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.

Key.Original: Float number, amount of air friction on the particle.\n0 - no impact (as if the particle was in vacuum).
Key.English: Float number, amount of air friction on the particle.\n0 - no impact (as if the particle was in vacuum).

Key.Original: Name of the shape associated with the particle.\nAs in a model onto a certain particle texture is applied.
Key.English: Name of the shape associated with the particle.\nAs in a model onto a certain particle texture is applied.

Key.Original: The interval of calling the 'OnTimer' event which executes the 'onTimerScript', in seconds.
Key.English: The interval of calling the 'OnTimer' event which executes the 'onTimerScript', in seconds.

Key.Original: Type of particle.\n'Billboard' = 2D (for example fire and smoke), 'SpaceObject' = 3D (for example flies).
Key.English: Type of particle.\n'Billboard' = 2D (for example fire and smoke), 'SpaceObject' = 3D (for example flies).

Key.Original: Volume of the particle (m^3).\nAffects the way the particle interacts with the surrounding air.
Key.English: Volume of the particle (m^3).\nAffects the way the particle interacts with the surrounding air.

Key.Original: Mass of the particle, in kg.\nAffects the way the particle interacts with the surrounding air.
Key.English: Mass of the particle, in kg.\nAffects the way the particle interacts with the surrounding air.

Key.Original: Size of the particle, in meters.\nParticle is scaled to size within the time the animation step lasts so if previous size is different you will see the particle change size accordingly.
Key.English: Size of the particle, in meters.\nParticle is scaled to size within the time the animation step lasts so if previous size is different you will see the particle change size accordingly.

Key.Original: Speed to play given animation phases at. Higher the number the faster the speed.\nIf frames to play ('Count' property in 'Basic Params') is set higher than 1 this has no visible effect.
Key.English: Speed to play given animation phases at. Higher the number the faster the speed.\nIf frames to play ('Count' property in 'Basic Params') is set higher than 1 this has no visible effect.

Key.Original: This shows which color is being edited for the given animation step, color or emissive color.
Key.English: This shows which color is being edited for the given animation step, color or emissive color.

Key.Original:
This shows the color preview.
NOTE:
- Does not necessarily appear 1:1 with the resulting particle color.
- Alpha/Luminance does not affect this preview.
Key.English:
This shows the color preview.
NOTE:
- Does not necessarily appear 1:1 with the resulting particle color.
- Alpha/Luminance does not affect this preview.

Key.Original: Red
Key.English: Red

Key.Original: Green
Key.English: Green

Key.Original: Blue
Key.English: Blue

Key.Original:
Switch alpha channel to luminance.
As in how illuminated flame is in NVG or how much it shows heat signature.
Values range from 0 to -10.
Unticked = normal alpha channel, ticked = luminance.
Key.English:
Switch alpha channel to luminance.
As in how illuminated flame is in NVG or how much it shows heat signature.
Values range from 0 to -10.
Unticked = normal alpha channel, ticked = luminance.

Key.Original: Alpha/luminance
Key.English: Alpha/luminance

Key.Original: Select color preset to use.
Key.English: Select color preset to use.

Key.Original: Opens a dialog to save custom color preset.
Key.English: Opens a dialog to save custom color preset.

Key.Original: Delete currently selected color preset
Key.English: Delete currently selected color preset

Key.Original: Give a name for your color preset.
Key.English: Give a name for your color preset.

Key.Original: Saves the currently selected animation step's color as a preset with the given name.
Key.English: Saves the currently selected animation step's color as a preset with the given name.

Key.Original: Back to Render Params
Key.English: Back to Render Params

Key.Original: Random color variation between the original color and this, applied to each animation step color separately.
Key.English: Random color variation between the original color and this, applied to each animation step color separately.

Key.Original: Color preview.
Key.English: Color preview.

Key.Original: Select emissive color as editable color.
Key.English: Select emissive color as editable color.

Key.Original: Resulting emissive color array.
Key.English: Resulting emissive color array.

Key.Original: Animation frame number, starts from 0.
Key.English: Animation frame number, starts from 0.

Key.Original: Previous animation frame.
Key.English: Previous animation frame.

Key.Original: Next animation frame.
Key.English: Next animation frame.

Key.Original: Animation frame count.
Key.English: Animation frame count.

Key.Original: Remove animation frame.\nNOTE that the frame to be removed is the last of the animation's frames, NOT the current selected one.
Key.English: Remove animation frame.\nNOTE that the frame to be removed is the last of the animation's frames, NOT the current selected one.

Key.Original: Add animation frame.\nNOTE that the frame is added after the last existing frame.
Key.English: Add animation frame.\nNOTE that the frame is added after the last existing frame.

Key.Original: Velocity of the particle created within the circle.\nVelocity is transformed and added to total velocity.
Key.English: Velocity of the particle created within the circle.\nVelocity is transformed and added to total velocity.

Key.Original: Sets the radius of the circle, in meters (radius of 1m = 2m diameter).
Key.English: Sets the radius of the circle, in meters (radius of 1m = 2m diameter).

Key.Original: Random interpolation for the life time of the particle, in seconds.\nAs in randomly picks life time for the particle between the 'LifeTime' property and this.
Key.English: Random interpolation for the life time of the particle, in seconds.\nAs in randomly picks life time for the particle between the 'LifeTime' property and this.

Key.Original: Select color as editable color.
Key.English: Select color as editable color.

Key.Original: Resulting color array.
Key.English: Resulting color array.

Key.Original: Float number, a random interpolation between the 'Angle' property in 'Basic Params' and this.
Key.English: Float number, a random interpolation between the 'Angle' property in 'Basic Params' and this.

Key.Original: Randomizer for the 'bounceOnSurface' param in 'Basic Params'.\n0-1 for collisions, -1 disable collision.
Key.English: Randomizer for the 'bounceOnSurface' param in 'Basic Params'.\n0-1 for collisions, -1 disable collision.

Key.Original: Randomizer for the animation scale (I assume for each step individually).\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.
Key.English: Randomizer for the animation scale (I assume for each step individually).\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.

Key.Original: Randomizer for red.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.
Key.English: Randomizer for red.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.

Key.Original: Randomizer for green.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.
Key.English: Randomizer for green.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.

Key.Original: Randomizer for blue.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.
Key.English: Randomizer for blue.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.

Key.Original: Randomizer for alpha/luminance.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.
Key.English: Randomizer for alpha/luminance.\nEach animation frame color is randomized independently.

Key.Original: A velocity vector for randomizing the original velocity even more,\ninterpolated between the original velocity, original RandomDirectionIntensity and -Perdiod, and this.
Key.English: A velocity vector for randomizing the original velocity even more,\ninterpolated between the original velocity, original RandomDirectionIntensity and -Perdiod, and this.

Key.Original: Random interpolation for the particle starting position between the 'Position' in 'Basic Params' and this.
Key.English: Random interpolation for the particle starting position between the 'Position' in 'Basic Params' and this.

Key.Original: Randomizer for the RandomDirectionIntensity in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.
Key.English: Randomizer for the RandomDirectionIntensity in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.

Key.Original: Randomizer for the RandomDirectionPeriod in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.
Key.English: Randomizer for the RandomDirectionPeriod in 'Basic Params'.\nInterpolates a random value between the original and this.

Key.Original: Type of damage. Only type 'Fire' is available.
Key.English: Type of damage. Only type 'Fire' is available.

Key.Original: How far from the core the core damage reaches, in meters.
Key.English: How far from the core the core damage reaches, in meters.

Key.Original: Amount of damage inflicted in the center of the emitter.
Key.English: Amount of damage inflicted in the center of the emitter.

Key.Original: The interval to inflict the CoreIntensity damage with, in seconds.
Key.English: The interval to inflict the CoreIntensity damage with, in seconds.

Key.Original:
Emitter delete timer, in seconds.
Applies to current selected emitter,
or if emitter is in a set applies it to all emitters in the set.
NOTE: does not make the emitter die out gradually, just deleted it after the given amount of time.
Key.English:
Emitter delete timer, in seconds.
Applies to current selected emitter,
or if emitter is in a set applies it to all emitters in the set.
NOTE: does not make the emitter die out gradually, just deleted it after the given amount of time.

Key.Original: Emitter/emitter set will 'follow' the hideObject state of the entity it/they are atteched on.\nIf object is hidden emitters will stop emitting, if object is shown emitters emit again.\nNOTE that this spawns a looping script for each entity this is enabled on.
Key.English: Emitter/emitter set will 'follow' the hideObject state of the entity it/they are atteched on.\nIf object is hidden emitters will stop emitting, if object is shown emitters emit again.\nNOTE that this spawns a looping script for each entity this is enabled on.

Key.Original: Import BIS effect module (fire, smoke) into the tool.\nNOTE: IF NO MODULE IS SELECTED ALL FIRE AND SMOKE MODULES PRESENT IN THE SCENARIO WILL BE IMPORTED.\nImported module(s) are deleted and replaced with emitters.
Key.English: Import BIS effect module (fire, smoke) into the tool.\nNOTE: IF NO MODULE IS SELECTED ALL FIRE AND SMOKE MODULES PRESENT IN THE SCENARIO WILL BE IMPORTED.\nImported module(s) are deleted and replaced with emitters.

Key.Original: Enable/disable the 'Particles' diagnostics.\nDisplays particles diagnostic data.\nUnfortunately the way this picks names to show takes all sorts of script names so it blocks some count data...
Key.English: Enable/disable the 'Particles' diagnostics.\nDisplays particles diagnostic data.\nUnfortunately the way this picks names to show takes all sorts of script names so it blocks some count data...

Key.Original: Enable/disable the 'ParticleNames' diagnostics.\nAttaches a name to each particle effect used so that it may be identified.\nMeans that a name is assigned to each particle, not the emitter.
Key.English: Enable/disable the 'ParticleNames' diagnostics.\nAttaches a name to each particle effect used so that it may be identified.\nMeans that a name is assigned to each particle, not the emitter.

Key.Original: Give a name for your preset.
Key.English: Give a name for your preset.

Key.Original: (OPTIONAL) Give a description for your preset.\nThis description is shown as a tooltip when you hover over the preset name in the 'Load Preset' dialog
Key.English: (OPTIONAL) Give a description for your preset.\nThis description is shown as a tooltip when you hover over the preset name in the 'Load Preset' dialog

Key.Original: Toggles saving the whole set (in which the current emitter belongs to) as a preset.\nNeeds equal sized set to import to when used.
Key.English: Toggles saving the whole set (in which the current emitter belongs to) as a preset.\nNeeds equal sized set to import to when used.

Key.Original: Saves the currently selected emitter's params as a preset with the given name.
Key.English: Saves the currently selected emitter's params as a preset with the given name.

Key.Original: Back to 'Export' leaf
Key.English: Back to 'Export' leaf

Key.Original: Export emitter params into the .rpt and the clipboard.\nExports all params (including lights*) unless the 'current only' box is checked.\n*Exclude lights by checking the 'exclude light emitters' box.
Key.English: Export emitter params into the .rpt and the clipboard.\nExports all params (including lights*) unless the 'current only' box is checked.\n*Exclude lights by checking the 'exclude light emitters' box.

Key.Original: Export only the current selected particle params.\nLight params can be exported via light editor export
Key.English: Export only the current selected particle params.\nLight params can be exported via light editor export

Key.Original: Export only particle emitter params even if emitter set includes a light emitter.\nNOTE that if 'export current only' is ticked this has no effect
Key.English: Export only particle emitter params even if emitter set includes a light emitter.\nNOTE that if 'export current only' is ticked this has no effect

Key.Original: 'Upload' params to selected emitter from above fields.\nFor pasting particle params from some script and such..
Key.English: 'Upload' params to selected emitter from above fields.\nFor pasting particle params from some script and such..

Key.Original: Opens a dialog for loading a saved particle preset into selected particle(s).
Key.English: Opens a dialog for loading a saved particle preset into selected particle(s).

Key.Original: Opens a dialog to save the selected emitter's params a preset.
Key.English: Opens a dialog to save the selected emitter's params a preset.

Key.Original: Scroll through parameters from selected emitter set.\nShows the name of the emitter which parameters are currently displayed in the fields.
Key.English: Scroll through parameters from selected emitter set.\nShows the name of the emitter which parameters are currently displayed in the fields.

Key.Original: Clears the 'export fields' of all data.
Key.English: Clears the 'export fields' of all data.

Key.Original: List of named selections on selected object model.\nNOTE: By default lists only selections that are off from object position.\nLists selections that can be retrieved via scripting.
Key.English: List of named selections on selected object model.\nNOTE: By default lists only selections that are off from object position.\nLists selections that can be retrieved via scripting.

Key.Original: Confirm attach
Key.English: Confirm Attach

Key.Original: Cancel the attach
Key.English: Cancel the attach

Key.Original: Show all selections (obtainable via scripting).
Key.English: Show all selections (obtainable via scripting).

Key.Original: Select particle preset to load
Key.English: Select particle preset to load

Key.Original: Load the selected preset params into the selected emitter
Key.English: Load the selected preset params into the selected emitter

Key.Original: Back to Export
Key.English: Back to Export

Key.Original: Delete selected preset.
Key.English: Delete selected preset.

Key.Original: Edit lightpoint parameters
Key.English: Edit lightpoint parameters

Key.Original: Save light emitter params as preset
Key.English: Save light emitter params as preset

Key.Original: 'Load' param preset 'into' a light emitter
Key.English: 'Load' param preset 'into' a light emitter

Key.Original: Export/import light params
Key.English: Export/import light params

Key.Original: Main color for the light. RGB.
Key.English: Main color for the light. RGB.

Key.Original: Ambient color for the light. RGB.
Key.English: Ambient color for the light. RGB.

Key.Original: Link main color and ambient color.n\As in make ambient color the same as main color (follows main color sliders).
Key.English: Link main color and ambient color.n\As in make ambient color the same as main color (follows main color sliders).

Key.Original: Light attenuation parameters
Key.English: Light attenuation parameters

Key.Original: Light intensity (brightness).\nNumeric value (scalar)
Key.English: Light intensity (brightness).\nNumeric value (scalar)

Key.Original: Toggle light flare on/off.nMeans the halo thingy around the light..
Key.English: Toggle light flare on/off.nMeans the halo thingy around the light..

Key.Original: Size of the flare.n\In meters.
Key.English: Size of the flare.n\In meters.

Key.Original: Maximun distance from how far the flare can be seen.n\In meters.
Key.English: Maximun distance from how far the flare can be seen.n\In meters.

Key.Original: Toggle light's visibility in daylight on/off.\n When checked the light will light up during daylight of the intensity is higher than the current light conditions.
Key.English: Toggle light's visibility in daylight on/off.\n When checked the light will light up during daylight of the intensity is higher than the current light conditions.

Key.Original: Position of the light emitter.\nIf attached to an object position is relative to that object.
Key.English: Position of the light emitter.\nIf attached to an object position is relative to that object.

Key.Original: Export light params to the clipboard and to the .rpt
Key.English: Export light params to the clipboard and to the .rpt

Key.Original: Export only the current selected light's params.n\When unchecked 'EXPORT' will export all light emitters in the scenario.
Key.English: Export only the current selected light's params.n\When unchecked 'EXPORT' will export all light emitters in the scenario.

Key.Original: 'Upload' params to selected emitter from above edit fields.\nFor pasting light params from some script and such..
Key.English: 'Upload' params to selected emitter from above edit fields.\nFor pasting light params from some script and such..

Key.Original: Object the light is attached to
Key.English: Object the light is attached to

Key.Original: Selection the light is attached to on the object, if any.
Key.English: Selection the light is attached to on the object, if any.

Key.Original: Light emitter delete timer, in seconds.\nApplies to current selected emitter,\nor if emitter is in a particle emitter set uses that set's dieout which can only be edited via the particle editor.
Key.English: Light emitter delete timer, in seconds.\nApplies to current selected emitter,\nor if emitter is in a particle emitter set uses that set's dieout which can only be edited via the particle editor.

Key.Original: Give a name for your light preset.
Key.English: Give a name for your light preset.

Key.Original: Saves the currently selected light's params as a preset with the given name.
Key.English: Saves the currently selected light's params as a preset with the given name.

Key.Original: Select light preset to load
Key.English: Select light preset to load

Key.Original: Toggle the use of default emitter set on/off.\nWhen unchecked SHIFT + INSERT will not insert the default emitter set.
Key.English: Toggle the use of default emitter set on/off.\nWhen unchecked SHIFT + INSERT will not insert the default emitter set.

Key.Original: Start Emitter 3Ditor by default with 3DEN.
Key.English: Start Emitter 3Ditor by default with 3DEN.

Key.Original: Select editor section to start the Emitter 3Ditor into with Eden.
Key.English: Select editor section to start the Emitter 3Ditor into with Eden.

Key.Original: Start Emitter3Ditor hidden (running but UI not shown).\nPress CTRL + BACKSPACE to 'maximize'.
Key.English: Start Emitter3Ditor hidden (running but UI not shown).\nPress CTRL + BACKSPACE to 'maximize'.

Key.Original: Show emitter names in Eden (both map and 3D view).
Key.English: Show emitter names in Eden (both map and 3D view).

Key.Original: When this is selected tool section will automatically change according to emitter type when emitter is selected.\nAs in selecting a light emitter on the edit area or from the entity list will change tool UI to Light 3Ditor, same with particle emitters.
Key.English: When this is selected tool section will automatically change according to emitter type when emitter is selected.\nAs in selecting a light emitter on the edit area or from the entity list will change tool UI to Light 3Ditor, same with particle emitters.

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor version
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor version

Key.Original: Disables the data validation on the UI parameter fields.\nUse at your own risk....
Key.English: Disables the data validation on the UI parameter fields.\nUse at your own risk....

Key.Original:
Coef for the data validation 'timer'.
As in how much time it takes before the data validation kicks in. Put here so you can adjust that for your liking.
Minimum value 1, maximum value 10.
The formula is 0.5 * coef. On array data it's 1.5 * coef max 8
Key.English:
Coef for the data validation 'timer'.
As in how much time it takes before the data validation kicks in. Put here so you can adjust that for your liking.
Minimum value 1, maximum value 10.
The formula is 0.5 * coef. On array data it's 1.5 * coef max 8

Key.Original: Disables the Surface snapping 'slavery' when dragging emitters with Surface Snapping on, as in when dragging emitters they will not follow object surfaces regardless of Surface Snapping state.\nUseful to turn this off if the feature causes you performance issues.\nNOTE that does NOT affect the Global Attach functionality with Surface Snapping.
Key.English: Disables the Surface snapping 'slavery' when dragging emitters with Surface Snapping on, as in when dragging emitters they will not follow object surfaces regardless of Surface Snapping state.\nUseful to turn this off if the feature causes you performance issues.\nNOTE that does NOT affect the Global Attach functionality with Surface Snapping.

Key.Original: Enables "Eden auto-dodging" feature.\nMeans that when this is enabled the tool UI will automatically fade out/in depending on if the mouse cursor is over either of the Eden side panels.\nThis feature can be temporarily disabled by pressing and holding down CTRL when entering the side panel areas.
Key.English: Enables "Eden auto-dodging" feature.\nMeans that when this is enabled the tool UI will automatically fade out/in depending on if the mouse cursor is over either of the Eden side panels.\nThis feature can be temporarily disabled by pressing and holding down CTRL when entering the side panel areas.

Key.Original: Disables hiding the tool UI with Eden UI when hiding it by pressing BACKSPACE.\nWhen this box NOT ticked the tool UI will hide with the Eden UI, and vice versa.
Key.English: Disables hiding the tool UI with Eden UI when hiding it by pressing BACKSPACE.\nWhen this box NOT ticked the tool UI will hide with the Eden UI, and vice versa.

Key.Original: Revert preferences to defaults.
Key.English: Revert preferences to defaults.

Key.Original: Re-enable all tool pop-up messages disabled by checking the 'Don't show this message again' box
Key.English: Re-enable all tool pop-up messages disabled by checking the 'Don't show this message again' box

Key.Original: Wipe everything edited with this tool from the scenario.\nUse when some error f's everything up to a point of no return..
Key.English: Wipe everything edited with this tool from the scenario.\nUse when some error f's everything up to a point of no return..

Key.Original: Define the default emitter set. Opens a new dialog
Key.English: Define the default emitter set. Opens a new dialog

Key.Original: Approve your emitter default set.
Key.English: Approve your emitter default set.

Key.Original: Return back to preferences. Default set unchanged.
Key.English: Return back to preferences. Default set unchanged.

Key.Original: Enable/Disable default set emitter.
Key.English: Enable/Disable default set emitter.

Key.Original: Type of emitter: particle or light.
Key.English: Type of emitter: particle or light.

Key.Original: Type of effect: class, preset or selected emitter's params.
Key.English: Type of effect: class, preset or selected emitter's params.

Key.Original: Effect class or preset.
Key.English: Effect class or preset.

Key.Original: When pressing INSERT default emitter set will allways be inserted instead of one emitter.\nSHIFT+INSERT is default set insert shortcut IF THIS IS UNTICKED.
Key.English: When pressing INSERT default emitter set will allways be inserted instead of one emitter.\nSHIFT+INSERT is default set insert shortcut IF THIS IS UNTICKED.

Key.Original:
Currently selected emitter.
Press 'INSERT' to insert a new emitter,

 or 'SHIFT+INSERT' to insert a set of emitters (depends on tool preferences if you have edited them).
Key.English:
Currently selected emitter.
Press 'INSERT' to insert a new emitter,

 or 'SHIFT+INSERT' to insert a set of emitters (depends on tool preferences if you have edited them).

Key.Original: Delete selected emitter.\nREQUIRES DOUBLECLICK to avoid accidents ;)
Key.English: Delete selected emitter.\nREQUIRES DOUBLECLICK to avoid accidents ;)

Key.Original: Clear emitter particle params and class.
Key.English: Clear emitter particle params and class.

Key.Original: Move camera to selected emitter.\nCTRL + HOME shortcut.
Key.English: Move camera to selected emitter.\nCTRL + HOME shortcut.

Key.Original: Rename selected emitter.
Key.English: Rename selected emitter.

Key.Original: Select the desired atach mode:\n'Basic', 'Selection' or 'Global'
Key.English: Select the desired atach mode:\n'Basic', 'Selection' or 'Global'

Key.Original: Last/currently used particle class (from config) or preset.
Key.English: Last/currently used particle class (from config) or preset.

Key.Original: Disable/Enable emitters.\nIn Eden only, previewing/playing the scenario the emitters still emit.\nHolding down CTRL while pressing this button disables/enables the selected emitters only (if any, all if none selected).
Key.English: Disable/Enable emitters.\nIn Eden only, previewing/playing the scenario the emitters still emit.\nHolding down CTRL while pressing this button disables/enables the selected emitters only (if any, all if none selected).

Key.Original: Hide the Emitter 3Ditor UI.\nSame as CTRL+BACKSPACE.
Key.English: Hide the Emitter 3Ditor UI.\nSame as CTRL+BACKSPACE.

Key.Original: Reveal the Emitter 3Ditor UI.\nSame as CTRL+BACKSPACE.
Key.English: Reveal the Emitter 3Ditor UI.\nSame as CTRL+BACKSPACE.

Key.Original: Switch to the particle editor section
Key.English: Switch to the particle editor section

Key.Original: Switch to the light editor section
Key.English: Switch to the light editor section

Key.Original: Edit basic particle params (sprite)
Key.English: Edit basic particle params (sprite)

Key.Original: Edit basic particle params (animation)
Key.English: Edit basic particle params (animation)

Key.Original: Edit particle Random (setParticleRandom)
Key.English: Edit particle Random (setParticleRandom)

Key.Original: Edit particle Circle (setParticleCircle)
Key.English: Edit particle Circle (setParticleCircle)

Key.Original: Edit particle damage (setParticleFire)
Key.English: Edit particle damage (setParticleFire)

Key.Original: Tool specific special actions
Key.English: Tool specific special actions

Key.Original: Export particle params for scripting use.\nstored both in clipboard and the .rpt file
Key.English: Export particle params for scripting use.\nstored both in clipboard and the .rpt file

Key.Original: Some tool settings
Key.English: Some tool settings

Key.Original: Attach emitter(s) to an object's model named selection.
Key.English: Attach emitter(s) to an object's model named selection.

Key.Original: Attach to object mode: Basic (object default position).
Key.English: Attach to object mode: Basic (object default position).

Key.Original: Attach to object mode: Selection (model named selection).
Key.English: Attach to object mode: Selection (model named selection).

Key.Original: Attach to object mode: Anywhere on object.
Key.English: Attach to object mode: Anywhere on object.

Key.Original: Use default emitter set defined in tool preferences.
Key.English: Use default emitter set defined in tool preferences.

Key.Original: <custom preset>
Key.English: <custom preset>

Key.Original: Custom preset
Key.English: Custom preset

Key.Original: 'Locks' the 'export fields' so that they won't get auto-filled with data when selecting emitters.\nHandy if you wish to 'paste' the same imported params to several different emitters, or something..
Key.English: 'Locks' the 'export fields' so that they won't get auto-filled with data when selecting emitters.\nHandy if you wish to 'paste' the same imported params to several different emitters, or something..

Key.Original: Clone the selected emitter.
Key.English: Clone the selected emitter.

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Export to clipboard and .rpt, done
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Export to clipboard and .rpt, done

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Export in config format to clipboard and .rpt, done
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Export in config format to clipboard and .rpt, done

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Preset emitter set count and selected emitter set count mismatch. Can not load preset.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Preset emitter set types and selected emitter set types mismatch. Can not load preset.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No preset selected.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Particle params missing. Paste aborted.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No emitters inserted

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Drop interval is not a number. Paste aborted.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Something is wrong with the pasted params, pasting aborted.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Params pasted succesfully.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: ready

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No name given for emitter

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Default emitter set ready

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No emitters present.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Preset saved

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: The current emitter is not a light emitter, or is a part of emitter set including particle emitters. Saving preset failed.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Selected object has no model selections.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: You can not 'ungroup' emitters from object attribute emitters.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: There's no emitter set to 'ungroup' from.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: running hidden (press CTRL + BACKSPACE to unhide)

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Paste in progress...

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Paste done

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Changing emitter attribute 'Name' is not allowed!

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Changing emitter attribute 'Init' is not allowed!

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Only one trigger per emitter/emitter set is allowed.

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Emitter can be attached to only one object at a time.
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Emitter can be attached to only one object at a time.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Emitter has no parameters set. Connection not allowed.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Emitting disabled

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: You can not change the text attribute of the emitter activating trigger.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Illegal character in data.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Only numeric data allowed in arrays!

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Only string data allowed in this field!

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Wrong datatype, should be %1, was %2

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No light emitter selected, can not load preset.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: No preset selected.

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Color preset removed

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Position not on object area

Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor was hidden via the 'minimize' button/CTRL+BACKSPACE

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Color must be an array!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Color must be an array!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Ambient color must be an array!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Ambient color must be an array!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Intensity must be a number!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Intensity must be a number!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Flare must be boolean!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Flare must be boolean!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: FlareSize must be a number!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: FlareSize must be a number!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: FlareMaxDistance muct be a number!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: FlareMaxDistance muct be a number!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Daylight must be boolean!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Daylight must be boolean!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Attenuation must be an array!
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Attenuation must be an array!

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Intensity is 0. Emitter will not emit any light...
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Intensity is 0. Emitter will not emit any light...

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Select only one emitter if you wish to clone (even if cloning a set)
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Select only one emitter if you wish to clone (even if cloning a set)

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Frame number can only be a <t underline='true'>NUMBER</7>.........
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Frame number can only be a <t underline='true'>NUMBER</7>.........

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Given frame number can not be larger than the frame count
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Given frame number can not be larger than the frame count

Key.Original: Emitter 3Ditor: Given frame number can not be less than 0
Key.English: Emitter 3Ditor: Given frame number can not be less than 0
